column1: - Impact investors (loan or convertible note with restrictions)

1. At $450/member/month the model is financially sustainable at scale (>750 members)
2. Break-even occurs around 750-900 members depending on growth rate and churn
3. Employer saves $10000-$15000 per employee per year vs traditional insurance
4. Initial capital requirement: $1M (covers startup + 18-24 months operating losses)
5. Mental health staffing is critical - represents 20-30% of total staff FTEs
6. Reinsurance costs ~10% of member fees ($54/member/month) for catastrophic coverage
7. At 1000 members annual surplus of $557k available for reserves and service expansion
8. Low churn (2-2.5%) through employer groups is essential to model sustainability
- Secure 1-2 anchor employers (200-400 employees total) before launch
- Maintain low administrative overhead (Federation model allows shared services)
- Invest heavily in care coordination (prevents expensive downstream costs)
- Negotiate strong reinsurance rates (critical to margins)
- Focus on preventive care utilization (reduces long-term costs)
- Maintain clinical quality to minimize member churn
Phase 1 (Months 1-6): Launch with 100-200 members validate operations
Phase 2 (Months 7-12): Grow to 400-600 members optimize staffing
Phase 4 (Months 25-36): Scale to 1200-1500 members build reserves for expansion
This model demonstrates that Keepwell Health Union is economically viable and delivers massive cost savings to employers while providing superior care access and experience to members.
